name: phonim
short_description:
Phonim assist blind or partially sighted programmers by unleashing the incredible power and efficiency of the vim text editor  through delivering configurable auditory and tactile feedback of everything that is happening on screen.

Efficient and powerful text manipulation is a key skill every programmer can't do without, and this is especially true for the blind or partially sighted computer professional. Although platform specific solutions for accessible expert text editing do exist, there is no platform independent and configurable solution for vim-style editing (see EdSharp + screen reader on Windows, vim + speakup on *nixand emacspeak on *nix and OSX).

Phonim aims to fill this gap by providing a single cross platform solution, bridging vim's screen output with an open source and cross platform text to speech and Braille system, and additionally with any other existing resident AT software.

If you want to help, please donate to the project or join the project team.
summary: Cross Platform Speech and Braille output system for Vim Text Editor
